result.execSummary:
The defendant Curt A Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  **Sex Offender Treatment.
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Do not reside with any person in any place in which children reside.  May Not have contact with any child under 18, T.B. (10/26/08).  Life Time Sex Offender.

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in person with Atty Bill Reddin. Victim Witness Coordinator, Regina Capitelli, present in court with victim's mother and grandmother.  Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 1048 -   Victim rights compliance. PSI rec'd and reviewed by all parties. Court has rec'd letters and supporting docs from Atty Reddin. Victim statements. Sentence recommendations.  Defendant is sentenced to 25 years in the WSP; 15 years Initial Confinement followed by 10 years of Extended Supervision. 4 days credit. DE (is not) eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. Court costs ordered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.  ** No contact with T.B. (dob 10/26/08), or any child under the age of 18. Lifetime S.O. Registry. Bond to be applied toward costs. Any remainder may be returned to the poster.
